TEXT.English: A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Zimba[COLOR_REVERT] increases your city's defenses aganst pre-gunpowder units and generates a small amount of culture. They are more expensive than the standard [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castle[COLOR_REVERT] but will reduce city maintenace by 20 percent.
TEXT.French: Une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]simba[COLOR_REVERT] augmente la défense des villes contre les unités avant la poudre à canon, et génère un peu de culture. Elles sont plus chères que les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]châteaux[COLOR_REVERT] mais réduise l'entretien de ville de 20%.
TEXT.German: A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Zimba[COLOR_REVERT] increases your city's defenses aganst pre-gunpowder units and generates a small amount of culture. They are more expensive than the standard [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castle[COLOR_REVERT] but will reduce city maintenace by 20 percent.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The word "Zimbabwe" could be a short form for "ziimba remabwe" or "ziimba rebwe", a Shona term, which means "the great or big house built of stone boulders". In the Karanga dialect of the Shona language, "imba" means "a house" or "a building" and "ziimba", or "zimba", mean "a huge/big building or house". A second theory is that Zimbabwe is a contracted form of "dzimba woye" which means "venerated houses" in the Zezuru dialect of the Shona language. This term is usually reserved for chiefs' houses or graves.

This term is usually reserved for chiefs' houses or graves.
